keyFactors.title: Elite Recent Volume
keyFactors.description: Smith averaged 6.2 receptions per game entering Week 11, well above 4.5 line. Last 5 games featured 99.8 yards per game average.

keyFactors.title: Jalen Hurts' Top Target
keyFactors.description: Smith commanded 28% target share in Eagles' passing attack. Clear WR1 with consistent usage regardless of game script.

keyFactors.title: A.J. Brown Injury Return
keyFactors.description: Brown returned from hamstring injury but expected to be limited. Smith projected to maintain elite target share.

riskFactors: Monday Night Football defensive environment could limit pass volume
Cold weather at Lambeau Field might suppress passing game
A.J. Brown's return could steal targets despite injury limitations

quarterBreakdown.description: Scoreless through three quarters. Smith caught 3 receptions on 5 targets for 33 yards. Hurts attempted just 18 passes through Q3 in defensive struggle.
TOUCHDOWN! Smith's 36-yard TD reception (contested catch over Evan Williams) gave Eagles 10-0 lead with 10:35 left. Added 1 more catch (16 yards on 3rd-and-12). Finished 4-for-7, 69 yards, 1 TD.

gameResults.whenMissed: Stuck at 4 receptions - needed exactly 1 more catch
gameResults.gamePace: Ultra-low-volume passing game. Hurts attempted just 26 total passes in 10-7 defensive slugfest. First 0-0 halftime NFL game since December 2023 limited all offensive stats.

whatWentWrong.title: Extreme Pass Volume Suppression
whatWentWrong.description: Hurts attempted just 26 passes total in historically low-scoring game (0-0 halftime, 10-7 final). Smith's 7 targets represented 27% target share but volume evaporated.

whatWentWrong.title: Quality Over Quantity
whatWentWrong.description: Smith's 4 catches were all high-leverage plays: 36-yard TD (contested), three 3rd-down conversions including clutch 16-yarder on 3rd-and-12 late. Impactful performance but one catch short.

whatWentWrong.title: One Catch Away
whatWentWrong.description: Needed exactly 5 receptions, finished with 4. Missed by smallest possible margin despite 69 yards and game-winning TD catch.

whatWentWrong.title: A.J. Brown Return Minimal Impact
whatWentWrong.description: Brown caught just 2 passes for 13 yards, showing injury limitations. Didn't steal targets but overall pass volume (26 attempts) was historically low.

statisticalContext.percentileRanking: Bottom 30% of Smith's reception performances despite TD catch

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: This was 75% variance, 25% analytical error. Smith's 6.2 receptions per game average and recent 6.7 RPG form supported the over, but the 10-7 defensive slugfest (0-0 halftime) created extreme variance. Missing by exactly 1 catch when Hurts attempted just 26 passes (vs typical 35+) is bad luck. However, betting reception overs in MNF game with extreme defensive potential (Eagles' elite pass rush vs Love) was analytical risk. Should have weighted potential for low-volume passing environment.

closingLineValue.verdict: Positive CLV - line moved toward Smith over as market recognized his target volume.

keyTakeaways: Reception props require pass volume - when QB throws just 26 times (vs 35+ typical), even elite WRs underperform
Quality over quantity: Smith's 4 catches included 36-yard TD and three 3rd-down conversions, but needed 5
Missing by exactly 1 reception (22.2% below line) in 10-7 game is variance, not total analytical failure
0-0 halftime games destroy all volume-based props across the board
Hurts praised Smith post-game but 26 pass attempts prevented volume ceiling
verdict: Brutal one-catch miss in historically low-scoring game. Smith's 6.2 RPG average and 28% target share supported the over, but 10-7 defensive slugfest (26 Hurts attempts vs typical 35+) killed volume. His 4 catches (69 yards, 1 TD, 3 third-down conversions) were impactful but one short. Defensive MNF environments (0-0 halftime) warrant extreme caution on reception overs regardless of player talent.
